body.name: WAVLINK AC600 Outdoor Weatherproof Wi-Fi Range Extender-Dual Band 2.4 & 5GHz Long Range Wireless Internet Signal Extender Booster&Router/AP/Repeater/WISP Mode with POE,No WiFi Dead Zones for Home
features: ✅【Withstand Harsh Outdoor Climates】- IP65-rated weatherproof housing that ensures continued operation in harsh outdoor environments or in climates of extreme cold, heat or continuous moisture; Robust weatherproof case withstands harsh outdoor conditions; Withstanding broad ranges of humidity and temperature (-30°C~70°C) (-22°F~158°F); 15KV ESD, 4KV lightning protection, ensure stable connection in harsh outdoor conditions

✅【Dual Band Outdoor Wi-Fi Extender】- This WiFi Signal Booster comes with next generation 802.11AC Wi-Fi technology, dual band external antennas provides up to 2.4GHz 150Mbps and 5GHz 433Mbps. Resolve the problem with a weak signal in an excellent manner, help to boost WiFi signal strength.The WAN port support 100Mbps.

✅【Multi Operation Modes】- The Outdoor Wi-Fi Access Point has integrated Power over Ethernet (PoE) support, allowing it to be installed in areas where power outlets are not readily available by combing your power and network data connection into a single RJ-45 cable. It supports wireless Repeater, Router, and Access Point (AP) mode.You can switch between these 3 modes.If you have any question,please contact us to download the new firmware or we will full refund for you or resend new item for you.

✅【Built-in High Power Amplifiers】- High Power Amplifiers PA+LNA 600mW and enhanced receiver design increase transmission power up to 5x . More strong penetration & longer range coverage than the general access point, ideal for providing Wi-Fi service in big area such as factory, community, street or etc

✅【2 x 7dBi Detachable Omni Directional Antennas】- Feature 2 x RP-SMA connectors for external antennas, and higher antenna gain extensively strengthens Wi-Fi signal and expands wider coverage in the open air, stability technology automatically avoids channel conflicts using its channel selection feature, meet outdoor long range coverage wireless network requirement, cover hard-to-reach dead zones

✅【Power Over Ethernet 】 This Outdoor Wi-Fi Access Point has integrated PoE support, it to be installed in areas where power outlets are not readily available by combing your power and network data connection into a single RJ-45 cable. Note: All Wi-Fi extenders are designed to increase or improve Wi-Fi coverage, not to directly increase speed. In some cases improving signal reliability can affect overall throughput.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: High Power for Multiple Outdoor Applications Get an IP65-rated Weatherproof ARIEAL HD2 AC600 Outdoor Dual Band High Power Wireless Wifi Booster, boost WiFi signal strength and extend your wi-fi signal to everywhere. Enjoy fast and stable wireless Wifi signal in patio,library,hotel,mall,factory, community, street etc.

Super-fast Wireless AC Performance Comes with next Wi-Fi generation-802.11AC technology, WN570HA1 operates on both 2.4GHz and 5GHz up to 600Mbps. It lets you keep more devices connected at the same time with the dual bands, which is superior choice for seamless HD streaming, online gaming and other bandwidth-intensive tasks. User-friendly Management System Easy Controller web-based management system for Windows,Mac OS X or Linux provides a suite of tools for IT managers,installers and network administrators to mange and maintain wireless networks.

Easy to Setup with Power Over Ethernet(POE) This Wireless Wifi Booster has integrated Power over Ethernet (PoE) support, allowing it to be installed in areas where power outlets are not readily available. By combing your power and network data connection into a single RJ-45 cable, you can install the Wifi Booster in hard to reach location. 3 IN 1 Repeater Mode is for extending wifi coverage of an existing wireless network Router Mode is for creating an instant private wireless network and enable multiple devices to share it AP Mode is for covering a wired network to a wireless network
How Does this WiFi Extender Work?

NOTE: Superior WiFi Speeds and Long-Range Coverage Not Compatible with Mesh Routers.Make sure the length of the Ethernet cable is less than 60 meters (196 ft).Make sure to use a certified CAT5e/CAT6 Ethernet cable with RJ45 connectors.Select the wireless network with a signal strength greater than 70% to get the most reliable connection.The outdoor antenna should be installed at a height of 2 meters above the roof or in a high open place for better reception.

Why describes the transmission distance “Outdoor 500m, Indoor 300m”, but actually it’s hard to achieve? -Wall material and thickness；-Wireless Transmit Power；-Antenna gain；-Working frequency band Under normal circumstances, the angle of the omnidirectional antenna in the room can be placed vertically to achieve the best results. When did I upgrade the firmware? You should not upgrade if you do not have any issues of your device. The only time you should consider an upgrade is if you are experiencing a problem with the device, and you have confirmed that the firmware addresses this problem. What can I do if I can’t enter into the webpage 192.168.10.1 or “ap.setup? For the repeater, you can use smart phone or computer to set:(Please see the setting video behind the product main image) Any question,welcome to us！

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 9, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Amazingly Good Solution!
reviews.reviewText: I bought a used 5th wheel RV last summer. I plan to live in it full time. Only one problem...the wifi in the main house (my roomie lets me use his for free) would never reach the RV. I spent about 6 months researching solutions and although this Wavlink product is pretty expensive it turns out I could not have done better.BE ADVISED...if you watch videos about how to set it up you'll see people attaching routers to their cable modems and running LAN cable through the walls and crawl spaces and buying expensive mounting arms and so on and so on. YOU DON'T NEED ANY OF THAT IF YOU WANT TO BRING WIFI TO AN OUT BUILDING!You do need to run the setup wizard from the location where you most want the wifi and pay attention to all the possibilities. I didn't the first time I tried to setup the repeater and thought I was in for a major hassle. Then I sat down and patiently went through all the screens. Bingo! Five bars of pure, clear, steady wifi. The trick is to refresh the available networks until the one you want shows up with even 1 bar. The setup will tell you that the signal is very weak. Ignore that. Input the password for whatever wifi signal you are trying to reach and the repeater will create a good, strong connection by adding a short extension to the network name. To use devices in the outbuilding, be sure you connect to the new extended network. You'll use the same password as already exists for the network.My RV is about 250 feet from the original cable modem and this model has no problem providing excellent signal. It's range, in feet, for those who don't do metric easily, is 650 + change. I can now be connected anywhere on a full acre.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good range, excellent customer service
reviews.reviewText: Very happy with the range I get out of these. I have the "typical" rural setup. One device is on the house, wired to my main router, the other is on the barn (300 feet line of sight away), to downlink to attach to my solar electric monitor.At first, was having issues getting it to assign IP addresses on the barn access point. No matter what I tried, it did not seem to work correctly. Had plenty of signal, but was not assigning addresses correctly.Contacted customer support, explained the issue (and, pro tip, here) included screenshots of ALL configuration screens. "Jason" replied the next day suggesting that, since I was configured as a , I should set the "Repeater Mode" in the wizard to "Bridge", as opposed to "Gateway", which is opposite of what the UI in the config suggests. Once I did this, all is working as expected, and I have full connectivity now in my barn, just like I had run a wire between them.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Works well, needs a few features to make it great.
reviews.reviewText: Update 8/14:Dead WiFi. So the short version... It was powered on and was working and then no WiFi....unplug and reset....no go. Spent a good 2 hours working through it and can connect via Ethernet cable and the unit is responsive (including firmware update without issue) but end result still no WiFi. It could find the signal I was looking to repeat, but that was about it. Conclusion I something broke. Needless to say it made for a trip to be annoying WiFi wise and have already gone another route.Update 7/21:So have had a few more outings and it continues to work well. This last weekend out garnered a few laughs. While paying for our stay another guest complained that since someone else was in the way, they cannot get a WiFi signal and had a rash of theories as to why it was "actually that way". For me, it was the same... signal went from 86% repeat strenght to 0% as there was a loss of line of sight at the distance we were staying.....except I simply moved the unit about 20' that had a better line of sight -- and went from no signal to 100% repeat strength. I still have to add in some more mounting options, but for now... it continues to be exactly what I was looking for.Overall it works great. A few caveats...but was what I was looking for. The unit is dead simple--- plug in...log in...run through the wizard...done. Almost done.So that is the simple answer...now the caveats. I use this to pick up a WiFi signal and repeat it. This is why it is designed to do. The issue is every time I go somewhere else, you have to run the wizard....you just can't pick a new signal from a scan to repeat, enter the password and retain all of your settings for the back end...you have to re-enter. That said sometimes you have to scan 3-5 times to find the WiFi signal you're looking for if there are a number of them around. So that leads to a huge plus that balances that...it creates a private LAN. The advantage is I can connect my devices and nobody else can see what I have connected. I wish it had more security protocols and that you could scan and enter a new WiFi signal password without running the wizard.With this being my first weekend out with it... I am pleased. It mounts easily and now I just have to make provisions for the wiring on a more permanent scale. Right now I have been streaming with a ROKU for 4-hours straight without a hiccup and have two phones connected as well.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good wifi if it works
reviews.reviewText: First off could not get it set up with the ethernet cable it came with, wouldn't even get power. Tried a new cable and no issues. Is kinda a hassle to set up. Worked for a few months grea, easily got 100' of signal. Then the poe it came with shorted out. Contacted wavlink about it and sent pictures of a literally melted poe and got no response back at all. Tried to buy a new poe and could not get it to connect again. 2 stars for faulty equipment and bad customer service. Will be looking into buying something else just not from them. Would of given 1 star but it did work well when it was working.Edit*- after the review customer service reached out to me told me which replacement POE would work and had me order it and after confirming the unit worked with the new Poe they would refund me the cost of the new poe. Edit to 4 stars for good customer service. Look forward to using the wifi extender again.
